conclusion: Calculate the potential difference U_{ab} using angular velocity ω, rod length 4L, and magnetic induction B.
The image shows a conductor rod ab of length 4L rotating in a uniform magnetic field with induction intensity B, around an axis through point O.
The conductor rod ab rotates at a constant angular velocity ω around an axis perpendicular to the paper surface passing through point O.
As the rod rotates, ends a and b experience a change in magnetic flux due to the magnetic field.
The potential difference U_{ab} is given by U_{ab} = 1/2 B ω (4L)^2.
Substituting the values, U_{ab} = 1/2 B ω (4L)^2 = 8BωL^2.
